scenarios.name: Classic Car Negotiation
scenarios.description: Two parties negotiate over a vintage car with opposing price goals
scenarios.context: Alice and Bob are negotiating the sale of a rare 1965 Mustang. They are old acquaintances but business rivals.
scenarios.aliceGoal: Buy the vintage car for under $10,000, but don't let Bob know I'm desperate.
scenarios.bobGoal: Sell the vintage car for at least $12,000. I suspect Alice really needs it for a collection.

scenarios.name: Salary Negotiation
scenarios.description: Employee and manager negotiate a raise with hidden constraints
scenarios.context: Alice is asking her manager Bob for a salary raise during their annual performance review. Both work at a tech startup.
scenarios.aliceGoal: Get at least a 20% raise. I have an offer from a competitor but prefer to stay here. Don't reveal the competing offer unless necessary.
scenarios.bobGoal: Keep the raise to 10% maximum due to budget constraints. I know Alice is valuable and don't want to lose her, but I can't show I'm worried.

scenarios.name: Diplomatic Crisis
scenarios.description: Two diplomats navigate a tense international situation
scenarios.context: Alice is the ambassador of Country X, and Bob is the ambassador of Country Y. A fishing boat incident has escalated tensions.
scenarios.aliceGoal: Secure an apology from Country Y without offering any compensation. Maintain Country X's reputation as strong but reasonable.
scenarios.bobGoal: Avoid any formal apology as it would set a bad precedent. Offer a goodwill gesture instead. Do not appear weak.

scenarios.name: High Stakes Poker Discussion
scenarios.description: Two poker players discuss hands while trying to read each other
scenarios.context: Alice and Bob are professional poker players having coffee after a tournament. They're discussing strategy while each tries to gain intel on the other's playstyle.
scenarios.aliceGoal: Learn Bob's tells and weaknesses while making him think I'm a straightforward player who rarely bluffs.
scenarios.bobGoal: Figure out how aggressive Alice plays while feeding her false information about my own cautious style.

scenarios.name: Startup Partnership Negotiation
scenarios.description: Two tech founders discuss a potential merger/partnership
scenarios.context: Alice's AI startup has great technology but is running low on funding. Bob's company has capital and distribution but needs better tech.
scenarios.aliceGoal: Secure investment or partnership without giving up more than 30% equity. Hide how desperate the cash situation is.
scenarios.bobGoal: Acquire Alice's technology for the lowest price possible. I know they might be running low on funds based on industry rumors.

scenarios.name: Apartment Rental Negotiation
scenarios.description: Landlord and prospective tenant negotiate terms
scenarios.context: Alice wants to rent Bob's downtown apartment. The market is competitive but the apartment has been listed for a while.
scenarios.aliceGoal: Get the rent lowered by $200/month and include parking. I know the apartment has been on the market for 2 months.
scenarios.bobGoal: Maintain the listed price and charge extra for parking. I need to fill this apartment soon but shouldn't appear desperate.

scenarios.name: Job Interview
scenarios.description: Candidate and interviewer have hidden agendas
scenarios.context: Alice is interviewing Bob for a senior developer position at her company.
scenarios.aliceGoal: Determine if Bob will stay for at least 2 years. We've had issues with developers leaving quickly. Also assess if he can handle our legacy codebase.
scenarios.bobGoal: Get the job but negotiate for remote work. I plan to relocate in 6 months and need flexibility. Don't reveal the relocation plan.

scenarios.name: Political Debate
scenarios.description: Two politicians debate while managing public perception
scenarios.context: Alice and Bob are candidates for mayor, appearing in a public debate. Each wants to appear reasonable while attacking the other's weaknesses.
scenarios.aliceGoal: Highlight Bob's lack of experience without seeming aggressive. Position myself as the unity candidate.
scenarios.bobGoal: Attack Alice's connections to corporate donors without looking negative. Present myself as the fresh alternative.

scenarios.name: Family Inheritance Discussion
scenarios.description: Siblings discuss dividing family estate with emotional complexity
scenarios.context: Alice and Bob are siblings discussing how to divide their late parent's estate. There are both valuable items and sentimental objects.
scenarios.aliceGoal: Get the family home. I have emotional attachment but also know it's worth the most. Make it seem about sentiment, not money.
scenarios.bobGoal: I want fair market value for everything. I suspect Alice wants the house for its value, not sentiment. Ensure I'm not shortchanged.

scenarios.name: Art Dealer Negotiation
scenarios.description: Art dealers negotiate over a potentially valuable painting
scenarios.context: Alice is an art dealer who found a painting at an estate sale. Bob is an expert who Alice has asked to evaluate it.
scenarios.aliceGoal: Get Bob to authenticate the painting without revealing how little I paid for it. If it's valuable, I want to buy it from the estate before they realize.
scenarios.bobGoal: I suspect this painting might be a lost masterpiece. If I confirm it, Alice will profit enormously. Maybe I should buy it myself or get a commission.

scenarios.name: Spy Information Exchange
scenarios.description: Intelligence agents exchange information with mutual distrust
scenarios.context: Alice and Bob are intelligence officers from allied but sometimes competing agencies, meeting at a neutral location to share intel.
scenarios.aliceGoal: Get information about the terrorist cell Bob's agency has been tracking. Share as little as possible about our sources.
scenarios.bobGoal: Learn what Alice's agency knows about the weapons shipment. Protect the identity of our embedded agent at all costs.

scenarios.name: Couples Therapy Session
scenarios.description: A couple in therapy each tries to get the therapist on their side
scenarios.context: Alice and Bob are a married couple in therapy. A mediator is observing. They're discussing division of household responsibilities.
scenarios.aliceGoal: Make the therapist see that Bob doesn't contribute equally to housework. But don't seem like I'm attacking him.
scenarios.bobGoal: Show that Alice has unrealistic standards and doesn't appreciate what I do. Appear open to compromise while standing ground.
